tags: i promise the rest of them are like at least prompt adjacent lmao
is jon supposed to be a hairy dude? cause lol rip if so
summary:
jonerys week, missing moment #2: getting to know one another

Jon’s brows have shot all the way up into his hairline. “I can’t...
caption:
jonerys week, missing moment #2: getting to know one another

Jon’s brows have shot all the way up into his hairline. “I can’t imagine any man saying anything so brazen to you,” he says. That anyone might speak to Daenerys Targaryen with such bitter and ugly disrespect stirs something in him he knows is primal, but clearly she handled herself. He is both proud and all the more attracted to her, attentive to nothing else but her life’s tale.

“Well he thought I didn’t speak Valyrian, you see. He was a foolish, boorish man.” Daenerys threads her fingers through Jon’s hair and smiles. “A shame for him and he alone. He no longer has words to tell.” Jon closes his eyes and huffs out a short breath of laughter. “No, I wouldn’t suppose he did. Apologies for calling you a child, Dany. But I did mean the both of us…”

The two of them tell each other everything on that boat, Daenerys telling him of her time in the khalasar, in Qarth, Yunkai, Astapor, Meereen, all of it. How she locked up two of her children while the third had run off in defiance of her, how her family and advisors and those close to her had consistently betrayed her but she found hope in herself and her children and in loving those who wronged her anyway. Jon shares his struggle to remain faithful to the Watch while his family wars in the lands below him, dying off one by one. How the freefolk offered him a refreshing change from warring over kingdoms, how he met a girl and broke his vows, and maybe he rushes a little over how that got him killed but he talks. They totally divulge their lives to each other and I cannot and will not be convinced otherwise

so here’s some cute chit chatting and hair touching :’)

The Last Dragons


Jonerys Week Day 2- Dragons

Obviously this is canon divergent with Aemon still being alive and meeting boatbaby.

summary: Game of Thrones faves → The White wolf, the King in the North The North remembers. We know no king but the King in the North...
caption:
Game of Thrones faves → The White wolf, the King in the North

The North remembers. We know no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark. I don’t care if he’s a bastard, Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins. He’s my king from this day, until his last day.

reblog.comment:
Game of Thrones faves → The White wolf, the King in the North

The North remembers. We know no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark. I don’t care if he’s a bastard, Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins. He’s my king from this day, until his last day.

trail.content_raw:
Game of Thrones faves → The White wolf, the King in the North

The North remembers. We know no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark. I don’t care if he’s a bastard, Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins. He’s my king from this day, until his last day.

summary: «𝙄 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙩 𝙝𝙚𝙧, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙚𝙬, 𝙖𝙨 𝙘𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙨 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙄 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙙𝙞𝙚, 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙄 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚𝙙 𝙝𝙚𝙧 𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙣 𝙖𝙣𝙮𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙙 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧...
body:
«𝙄 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙩 𝙝𝙚𝙧, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙚𝙬, 𝙖𝙨 𝙘𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙨 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙄 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙙𝙞𝙚, 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙄 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚𝙙 𝙝𝙚𝙧 𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙣 𝙖𝙣𝙮𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙙 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙨𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙤𝙧 𝙞𝙢𝙖𝙜𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙙 𝙤𝙣 𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙝…»

© Vladimir Nabokov, “Lolita”.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: restitutor-orbis
blog.title: The Resteror of the World
blog.description: There is much in this world to distaste, but so much to love as well.

summary: Marriage between Dany and Jon would have been the smart thing to do, Varys
body:
Marriage between Dany and Jon would have been the smart thing to do, Varys

You know what it’s fucking annoying about the final? Everything would be better with the marriage of the King of the North, Jon Snow, and the Queen of the Iron Throne, Daenerys Targaryen, in season 7.

Think about it. Theoretically, the North would be independent; but in practicality, it would most likely enjoy the benefits of any other provience under the Iron Throne, since Dany wouldn’t, you know, tax the North relentlessly on things like grain and wheat, and any support that may be needed would be sent since the marriage between Jon and Dany would be based on love, while also serving as a political advantage.

Another reason would be the fact that eldest son/child—which was fucking hinted in the 7th season—born between the two monarchs would inherit the North and the Iron Throne with the passing of his/her parents, unifying the Seven Kingdom once more. While some Northern lords would be discontent with that, the fact that the Stark blood runs in this hypothetical monarch’s veins would lessen the animosity between the crown and the North.

Third, if we are accepting Jon would reveal his secret as the son of Rhaegar and Lyanna, the mundle mess of succession would be cleared away. Either Jon denounces his claims to the Iron Throne, serving most likely as a Prince-Consort/KiTN, or he announces it. But, with the marriage between Daenerys and Jon, the two claimant lines would be forged as one. An historical precedence for this is the marriage between Aegon III, son of Queen Rhaenyra, and Queen Jaehaera, daughter of Aegon II, which helped ease tensions between the remaining green loyalist and help unite the Targaryen line after the death of Aegon II. A historical precedent in our world would be the marriage between King Henry VII, who had conquered the English throne with the defeat of King Richard III by Henry’s armies at the Battle of Bosworth Field, and Queen Elizabeth, daughter of Edward VI and the niece of Richard III. This too help stabilize the realm and ease tensions between the two factors and unite the English line.

But, no. In the end, we got a stupid fucking soap opera. Instead of thinking of the political suave thing to do, Varys is like, “Dany got no dick. Dick good. Jon got good northern dick.” It’s fucking stupid. Fuck D&D
